body_content.explanation: someone whose job is putting goods or other things on shelves, or putting things on top of each other:
examples: The supermarket is recruiting checkout clerks and shelf stackers.
I got a job as a crate stacker for a brewery.
He worked as a stacker at the public library.

body_content.explanation: a machine for putting things on top of each other:
examples: Devices are fed from automatic tray stackers.
All warehouse equipment (order pickers, stackers, lifting devices conveyors, fork lift trucks, etc.) must be fire resistant.

body_content.explanation: a set of containers that are designed to be put on top of each other:
examples: To keep nappies and other baby products out of the way, invest in one of these pretty stackers for the nursery.

body_content.explanation: a child's toy in which similar items of different sizes must be put on top of each other :
examples: A stacker makes a great first "puzzle" for a baby or toddler.
Toddlers will develop their motor skills and coordination with this bunny stacker toy.

body_content.explanation: a type of sandwich with several different types of food on top of each other:
examples: Their Italian deli-style stackers are the best in the city.
